In frameworks, remove Adobe headers from all files except xml/mxml file types.  There are also a few .txt files that are license files that I didn't touch yet.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

fix offsets for FB.  Convert line ending from lf to crlf in svn for the proects directory only.  When checking project files in, be sure to save you files this way.  Another update to make sure happens is set the svn properties svn:eol-style = native and svn:mime-type = text/plain (these have been updated on theses files as well)
QE notes: make sure the proper class is selected
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Two AIR bug fixes around Window.open().
1.  When open() is called on a closed window, nothing happens.  We decided this is NAB, so I’m just clarifying the docs.

2.  Adding a WINDOW_CREATING event for automation.  The WINDOW_CREATE event happens too late in the game for them (this is thrown in the enterFrameHandler).  They wanted something more synchronous so they could catch what was happening based on the user-interaction more immediately.
Tests run: checkintests, ran a small subset of AIR halo and spark Window tests
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Found a bug when I was fixing visibility issues for AIR.  "windowClose" as an event name conflicts with another internal event that Window/WindowedApplication use.  To fix this, I'm changing the newly added WindowedSystemManager.WINDOW_CLOSE to "globalNotifyWindowClose".  This class (and the event) is an internal class that is only used by automation.  I've run this change by the automation team to make sure it is ok.
Tests run: checkintests, Rob ran WindowedApplication and Window tests
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Complete Spark WindowedApplication and Spark Window.

* When you turn System Chrome off you do not get Flex Chrome automatically anymore. You need to set the skinClass style to use FlexChromeSkin. This means if System Chrome is not present the WindowedApplication will not have chrome.
* FlexChromeSkin brightens/dims its chrome depending on its active/inactive state.

* The TitleBarSkin was split into two skins, TitleBarSkin and MacTitleBarSkin. TitleBarSkin has just the Windows look. MacTitleBarSkin has the mac look. TitleBar will automatically switch between the skins depending on the OS.
* titleText in the TitleBarSkin and the MacTitleBarSkin is truncated when the text doesn't fit in the Window.
* statusText in FlexChromeSkin is truncated if the text does not fit with the status bar.
